title: Penn students, look forward to 2021
description: The problems from this calendar year won't go away on Jan. 1, 2021. But better days are ahead.
author: The Daily Pennsylvanian Editorial Board

title: When did alone time become so unappealing?
description: If there’s one thing we should learn from the pandemic, it’s that alone time should be more appreciated.
author: Bridget Yu

title: The Year Penn Failed Its International Students
description: After months of last-minute decision making, Penn's international students are left bearing the brunt of the cost of a virtual semester, with potentially long-term consequences.
author: Bruce Shen

title: As 2020 ends, celebrate your resilience and vow to carry it forward
description: 2020 has tested each of us, forcing us to build a strong will and resilient spirit. Don't lose that in 2021.
author: Varun Saraswathula

title: Penn’s Year of Civic Disengagement
description: Penn's Year of Civic Engagement has largely failed to make a major impact in encouraging civic engagement across the University, even as the community demands activism.
author: Isabella Glassman
